channel.title: Podnews Daily - podcast industry news
channel.description: Daily news for the podcast and on-demand audio industry - from Apple Podcasts to Spotify, YouTube Music to Joe Rogan. Podnews also covers the latest jobs and events and trending shows in a short update every weekday. editor@podnews.net - visit https://podnews.net to get our free newsletter.

item.title: Inside the AI podcast factory
item.description: We talk with Jeanine Wright about Inception Point AI. Sponsored by SoundStack. Heading to Programmatic I/O and/or Advertising Week NY? Let‚Äôs talk fast, simple monetization to keep your podcast and streaming businesses growing. https://podnews.net/cc/3048 Visit https://podnews.net/update/jeanine-wright-interview for the story links in full, and to get our daily newsletter.
item.content:encoded:
Sponsored by SoundStack. Heading to Programmatic I/O and/or Advertising Week NY? Let‚Äôs talk fast, simple monetization to keep your podcast and streaming businesses growing.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm releasing 3,000 episodes a week and I have eight people on my team. There‚Äôs no way we‚Äôre listening to the overwhelming majority of our content before it‚Äôs released.‚Äù

  • Exclusive: This week in the Podnews Weekly Review podcast, we speak with Inception Point AI CEO Jeanine Wright, about her AI-driven podcast company. The company released a show about Charlie Kirk within an hour of his shooting, we learn; and traditional podcast companies are ‚Äújust not finding sustainable business models‚Äù, she says. You‚Äôll find the interview in full, wherever you get your podcasts - it‚Äôs sponsored by Buzzsprout.
  • Spotify is working on tools to govern the use of AI-generated content - but for music only. Its disclosures feature will be based on an industry standard, and be nuanced in its approach: but will be voluntary by music producers.
  • If you‚Äôre heading to New York, you (or your clients!) should watch some comedy podcasts on stage between Oct 7-9 as part of the Cheerful Earful Podcast Festival. Tickets are going fast - make sure to grab some.

> > > Read more of today‚Äôs podcast industry news stories on the Podnews website: and get our free daily newsletter.

item.title: New Heights makes it to Amazon Prime Video
item.description: As long as you're in the US, that is. Sponsored by SoundStack. Heading to Programmatic I/O and/or Advertising Week NY? Let‚Äôs talk fast, simple monetization to keep your podcast and streaming businesses growing. https://podnews.net/cc/3048 Visit https://podnews.net/update/new-heights-prime-video for the story links in full, and to get our daily newsletter.
item.content:encoded:
Sponsored by SoundStack. Heading to Programmatic I/O and/or Advertising Week NY? Let‚Äôs talk fast, simple monetization to keep your podcast and streaming businesses growing.

  • Amazon Prime Video is now showing New Heights with Jason & Travis Kelce in the US. The show is owned by Wondery, an Amazon subsidiary. Here‚Äôs the show page, which appears to be sorted by oldest-first. It doesn‚Äôt appear to be available on Amazon Prime Video in other countries but is available on YouTube internationally - we‚Äôve asked why.
  • QCODE has expanded to become a brand of Daylight Media, a new venture designed for creators to scale reach and monetization. QCODE founder and CEO Rob Herting will lead Daylight Media as CEO. The company has also announced a sales and distribution partnership with The Weekly Show with Jon Stewart.
  • Libsyn has signed Girls Next Level, the pop culture podcast hosted by Holly Madison and Bridget Marquardt. The show signed with AdLarge in 2022, and Audioboom‚Äôs Creator Network in 2023.

item.title: Do listeners want podcasts made with AI?
item.description: Some parts of the population are particularly wary. Sponsored by SoundStack. Heading to Programmatic I/O and/or Advertising Week NY? Let‚Äôs talk fast, simple monetization to keep your podcast and streaming businesses growing. https://podnews.net/cc/3048 Visit https://podnews.net/update/ai-podcasts-listeners for the story links in full, and to get our daily newsletter.
item.content:encoded:
Sponsored by SoundStack. Heading to Programmatic I/O and/or Advertising Week NY? Let‚Äôs talk fast, simple monetization to keep your podcast and streaming businesses growing.

  • Do listeners want to listen to podcasts produced with AI? New research unveiled by Sounds Profitable today shows that some parts of the population are particularly wary. ‚ÄúAI may be coming to podcasting, but no one can be made to like it,‚Äù suggests Tom Webster. (Podnews is 50% owned by Podcast Movement, which incorporates Sounds Profitable).
  • The Signal Awards has revealed the finalists for this year‚Äôs awards - and opened voting for the Listener‚Äôs Choice Awards in every category. You‚Äôve until Oct 9 to vote.
  • On the company‚Äôs fifteenth anniversary, Spanish-language podcast platform iVoox has unveiled a new brand identity.

> > > Read more of today‚Äôs podcast industry news stories on the Podnews website: and get our free daily newsletter.
